column4: What's the advantage of a NAS over a regular external hard drive?
a network connection so it can be accessed by multiple machines at the same time ?
every NAS should be accessed remotely, otherwise it'd be just a simple stupid hard disk ;-)

I was looking into get the WD My Book World Edition NAS as it was highly rated, but apparent to access your files remotely you have to go through WD's website, but I read it could be hacked to access the drive directly via SSH or FTP?
